tasks.task: Attach a trailer to a truck.
subtasks: Drive the truck to the field where the trailer needs to be attached.
Park the truck in a position where the trailer can be safely and efficiently attached.
Secure the trailer to the truck using appropriate hardware and tightening mechanisms.
Check the stability and security of the attachment to prevent any accidents or damage during transportation.

tasks.task: Load the trailer with farm equipment or supplies.
subtasks: Unload the equipment or supplies from the existing location, such as a shed, garage, or storage area.
Carefully load the equipment or supplies onto the trailer, ensuring they are placed securely and do not shift during transport.
Secure the load with straps, tarps, or other materials to prevent movement and potential damage.
Inspect the loaded trailer to ensure all items are safely in place before beginning the transport.

tasks.task: Operate the truck and trailer to transport the equipment to another location.
subtasks: Start the truck engine and perform a pre-trip inspection to ensure the vehicle is roadworthy.
Check the trailer's brakes, lights, and coupling to ensure proper function.
Drive the truck and trailer to the destination, adhering to traffic laws and regulations.
Navigate any terrains or obstacles that may be present on the route to the field.

tasks.task: Unload the equipment from the trailer at the new location.
subtasks: Park the truck and trailer in a safe area near the site where the equipment needs to be unloaded.
Detach the trailer from the truck carefully, ensuring it is disconnected securely.
Check the trailer for any signs of damage during transport.
Load the equipment from the trailer to the intended new location, such as a field, shed, or equipment area.
Verify that all equipment has been properly unloaded and is set up or stored as needed.

tasks.task: Perform routine maintenance on the truck and trailer.
subtasks: Check fluid levels (oil, coolant, brake fluid) in the truck before and after transport.
Inspect the tires for wear and air pressure, adjusting as necessary.
Clean the exterior of the truck and trailer to maintain proper functioning and appearance.
Lubricate moving parts of the trailer as needed to ensure smooth operation in future use.
